Visit Every Family.--As the shepherd of the flock he [the minister] should care for the sheep and the 
                                                                           347
lambs, searching out the lost and straying, and bringing them back to the fold. He should visit every family, not merely as a guest to enjoy their hospitality, but to inquire into the spiritual condition of every member of the household. His own soul must be imbued with the love of God; then by kindly courtesy he may win his way to the hearts of all, and labor successfully for parents and children, entreating, warning, encouraging, as the case demands.--Signs of the Times, Jan. 28, 1886.
